and Aardwolf's Discord channel https://discord.gg/KH62U8P
Don't forget our clan skills:
mutare (double / half the weight of an item) 
napalm (str and int buff)

You wake and stand up.
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.

(Player) (White Aura) Drimshade the Navigator.

Someone falls asleep.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

The Great Eastern Desert (732)

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Stairway Landing
  You stand on a large flat section of floor.  Stairs spiral down into
darkness and also up into the gloom above.  Small cobwebs drift about, and
small insects scuttle away from your light.  You can go south, up, or down. 

<MAPEND>

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

[*Daily Blessing*] 129/545 HP  317/578 MP  785/785 mv  1014tnl

e
e
Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

[*Daily Blessing*] 129/545 HP  317/578 MP  784/785 mv  1014tnl  
Lv 18  G 63011 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Aeleron's Alchemy Supplies (G)
  This small stand is surrounded by an average sized fence, which has
only three openings to let customers into the shop.  The small fence
contains a vast number of cauldrons boiling and bubbling with liquids of
reds, blues, magentas, and greens.  Many signs sit everywhere, saying,
"Do not touch!",  "Leave it alone!",  and "Hands to Yourself!".
A small, old gnome stands on a step stool, busily pouring a bubbling gel
into a small flask.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east west ]
A plump dwarf, Radnir, walks past slowly, admiring the views.
This noble is walking quite quickly, probably to avoid you!
(White Aura) A gray-haired, old gnome is enveloped in smoke as an attempt to bottle 'immolation'
goes awry.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Inix the Hunter is sleeping in a trivia sleeping bag.
(Player) (White Aura) Drimshade the Navigator.
Lieutenant Pixie smiles up at you as she gets ready to amputate your leg.

The Great Eastern Desert (732)

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

n
Entrance
  You stand in the shade of the temple entrance.  To the south the sun
blazes relentlessly onto the desert sand.  To the north lies the dark and
forbidding entrance to the temple.  From deep within the deserted catacombs
blows a slight breeze, as though the temple were breathing.  The air wafting
from the entrance smells of centuries of decay.  You wonder which is worse,
the hot blazing sun, or the stench of decay coming from within the
synagogue?  

<MAPEND>

A long corridor
  You stand in a long dark corridor.  Dust and sand lie in drifts on the
floor, blown in by the desert wind.  Your footsteps echo hollowly from the
dark stone walls, or is there someone following you?  No, it's just an echo. 
The corridor continues north and south.

<MAPEND>

A Four Way Intersection
  You stand at a four way crossing.  Dust trickles down from cracks in the
stone above.  You begin to wonder just how stable this ancient masonry
really is!  Small piles of sand lie in drifts on the floor.  You can go in
any direction.

Stairway Landing
  You stand on a large flat section of floor.  Stairs spiral down into
darkness and also up into the gloom above.  Small cobwebs drift about, and
small insects scuttle away from your light.  You can go south, up, or down.

Spiral Stairway

  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Entrance
  You stand in the shade of the temple entrance.  To the south the sun
blazes relentlessly onto the desert sand.  To the north lies the dark and
forbidding entrance to the temple.  From deep within the deserted catacombs
blows a slight breeze, as though the temple were breathing.  The air wafting
from the entrance smells of centuries of decay.  You wonder which is worse,
the hot blazing sun, or the stench of decay coming from within the
synagogue?

Hidden Room
  You stand in a small 10' square room.  The air is heavy and musty, almost
gagging you.  Trying to breathe shallowly you glance around at the dark
stone walls, they seem to be covered with fine carvings.  There is a pile of
rags on the floor in one corner.  Everything is covered by a layer of fine
dust.

Lower Landing
  You stand at the bottom of a flight of spiral stairs.  To the south a
corridor stretches into the darkness.  Small cobwebs cover most of the
stonework, and small piles of dust lie on the floor.  The air is dry and
warm, but you are surprised to notice the faint hint of moisture in the air!

Infirmary (G)
  Oh no it looks like the perils of Aardwolf have overcome you and you have 
fallen in battle. No worries though it looks like your fellow soldiers were 
able to recover your body and resurrect your spirit. It's a strange feeling 
seeing your body on the ground. IMPORTANT: Make sure you loot everything 
off your corpse and it decomposes before you leave the room! Sometimes
you might have issues seeing the invisible objects on your corpse. You can 
buy a detect invisibility potion from our shop run s3e from here and type 
list. Also don't be afraid to ask for a miracle on clantalk. If it works 
it could help restore some of your lost experience. The Medical Lounge is 
south from here in case you need a healer.

[ Exits: (up) ]

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

Aeleron's Alchemy Supplies (G)
  This small stand is surrounded by an average sized fence, which has
only three openings to let customers into the shop.  The small fence
contains a vast number of cauldrons boiling and bubbling with liquids of
reds, blues, magentas, and greens.  Many signs sit everywhere, saying,
"Do not touch!",  "Leave it alone!",  and "Hands to Yourself!".
A small, old gnome stands on a step stool, busily pouring a bubbling gel
into a small flask.

<MAPEND>

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Gateway to Solan
  This is the gateway to the Town of Solan. It keeps the monsters out. This is 
a peaceful farming town near the shores of Big Tree Lake. There is a sign 
nailed to a nearby tree. There is a plaque embedded in the road. There is a 
gate to Mesolar to the north. To the east and west are the town's two 
watchtowers. A road into Solan leads south.

Outside the Inn of the Sleeping Bear
  The Inn of the Sleeping Bear rests within a huge oak tree. Warm laughter 
tumbles from the inn. The inn was the only piece of the town that survived 
the earthquake intact. The steps wind around the giant tree trunk up to the 
familiar, carved wooden door. Engraved in the door is an image of a sleeping 
bear.

Inn of the Sleeping Bear
  Roark is an older man with a gift for drink mixing and cooking. His hair is 
mostly gray with some brown still peeking through. He glances at you briefly,
then leans over to you.

Roark whispers, "A magical staff! I bet it was forged by demons from the
terrible Darken Wood. There are terrible mysteries in that place, there are."

Reading Room
  This is a reading room provided by the inn for any who want to use it. It is 
a wonderful place to read on sunny days when the afternoon sun shines through
the large picture window. The walls are lined with bookshelves full of books.
Some of the titles sound interesting, others not as much. The chairs look 
quite comfortable with big soft cushions all around. The people in this room 
are absorbed in their reading, resulting in a very quiet room.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Vast Corridor (745)

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.

Hallway in the Demon Clan
  You are standing in a hallway that leads to the chambers of the members
of the cult.  The hallway is only used when the cult members travel from
their beds to where they work for the demons.  The floor is pitch black and
the ceiling is dark grey.  The west wall depicts the many different levels of
the abyss.

The hallway continues north and south, there is a door to the east.

sleep.  The room is about ten feet by ten feet, with the ceiling resting ten
feet off the ground.  There is a simple mat on the ground where the clan
member sleeps.  Painted on the walls are scenes from the various planes of
the Abyss.

Eastern Summoning Chamber
  You stand in a large chamber that was built to summon the many different
demons of the abyss.  There is a large pentagon in the centre of the
chamber while all the walls are covered with magical wards and holy
symbols to confine a demon once it is summoned.  This chamber
specializes on the level of the abyss that Graz'zt rules.

There is a door to the north, the chamber goes to the east and south.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)

enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the

adventurers.

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.

Before the East Entrance (G)
  You stand just at the east entrance to the Underdark.  Before you looms a
huge cavern, or so you think, since you can't tell with your eyes.  Darkness
is everywhere, there is a layer of light that has been formed by a series of
floating orbs that rest above your head.  Above this layer of light, darkness
lies.  It is because of this that you think you stand in a huge cavern.  The
air smells of thousands living in a confined space with little fresh air.  The
air itself is moist and warm.  Sounds assault your ears, not just the buzzing
of people, but also agonized screams.  The shadows seem to speak of
death.  Welcome to the Underdark. 
 
The north and south is Sunrise, to the east is the entrance and to the west is
the Slaver's Route and farther down, the market area.

<MAPEND>

Road of Shadows

Underdark like the shadows thus they walk this road frequently.

[*Daily Blessing*] 438/545 HP  373/578 MP  785/785 mv  378tnl  
Lv 18  G 59720 | Thieves' Guard Room (W)
>>
Kick whom?

[*Daily Blessing*] 438/545 HP  373/578 MP  785/785 mv  378tnl  
Lv 18  G 59720 | Thieves' Guard Room (W)
>>
help mutare
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Mutare.
Help Category : Clans.
Related Helps : Bootcamp.
Last Updated  : 2018-02-19 21:50:59.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: Mutare <item> <double|half>
 
Boot Camp has the knowledge to take something within their possession and
modify the item's weight by making it twice as heavy or reducing the weight
by half. Unfortunately, due to the special materials that are used when
increasing or decreasing the weight of an item, this can only be done once
per item and cannot be used on containers.

INFO: When the clan skill is used, the person will be automatically charged 
a total of 3 gold multiplied by the level of the item being modified. How 
often the clan skill works is based on your clan rank and your level 
compared to the level of the item you are trying to mutare. The clan skill 
will also add an ownership flag to the item it is used on, if one is not 
already present. Mutare can be used on items owned by your spouse and 
ownership will not be changed.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 438/545 HP  373/578 MP  785/785 mv  378tnl  
Lv 18  G 59720 | Thieves' Guard Room (W)
>>


ct "help mutare" for info
You tell the CLAN: '"help mutare" for info'

[*Daily Blessing*] 419/573 HP  303/601 MP  785/802 mv  1924tnl

help dust devil
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Dust Devil'.
Help Category : Followers.
Related Helps : Animal friendship, Conjure elemental, Pets.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-07 09:52:16.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax:  cast 'dust devil'
         cast 'dust devil' <dust devil name>
Spell Number: 141

This spell calls upon the forces of air to summon a minor air elemental (a
dust devil to be exact) to come to the aid of the caster.  You may only
have one dust devil under your control at a time through use of this spell. 
Dust devil names are visible to all, and as such, may be policed
by the Immortals- please keep names appropriate.

Primary stat: Constitution
Affected by : Wisdom, Luck

Your stats help determine all the stats of your dust devil including
its hit points, hit roll and resistances.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Lv 19  G 59849 | Thieves' Guard Room (E)

Entrance to the Thieves' Guild 
  You are standing just inside the thieves' guild.  The hallway is large and
spacious.  There are many statues and other objects that have been stolen
from the various rich members of the world.  The floor is dark green and
polished.  The walls are white marble.

Thieves' Guard Room
  You are standing in the eastern guard room.  There are a couple bunks
along the walls and a table that has dice on it in the middle of the room.

walls are grey.  Small rods that are held in little holders along the walls
light the room.

The sole exit is the door to the west.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

The Grand City of Aylor (G) [**>NOPK<**]
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

An Overgrown Forest Trail
  This once heavily used trail has slowly been reclaimed by the forest at
either side of it.  Even thousands of years have not allowed the forest to
entirely erase the trail, as faint traces of the magic that maintained the
trail are still present.  Tall grasses now grow, however the path is still
quite noticeable.

Forest Trail

distance betrays the sheer size of the building that now stands in front of

An Old Town Road
  At first glance, the road in this part of the town seems to not have any
sort of buildings to lead you to.  You can just make out a path used by the
wood elves to the west and east of the road.  The forest stays undisturbed
as the elves pass; it seems to bend to make the way easier for its partners.
As you peer down each path large buildings become visible, and many elves
can be seen entering and leaving.

An Old Town Road
  As the old road approaches the castle, you come across the two last stone
buildings in the village.  Unlike other parts of the town you hear a series
of loud cheers, cries, and laughter all at once.  Suddenly, a halfling
quickly runs out from the west shouting, "More gold for the bar!"  But
weaving as he does so.  He continues to the east, slamming into the bar's
wall.  Looks like he's had enough already.

n
Drawbridge to a Ruined Castle
  Despite the castle's severe age the drawbridge seems to be in perfect
condition.  The wood that it is made from seems as if it was cut only a few
days ago.  The chains tense briefly as the elves test the drawbridge
mechanism.  The drawbridge rises a few feet off the ground then returns.  It
is doubtful if the orcs will be able to penetrate these defenses.

n
Castle Grounds
  The castle grounds are well taken care of.  Flowers in various stages of
bloom, and bushes hiding the cracked and damaged walls of the castle, are
all but a few of the features of this garden.  Large shrubberies are cut
into various shapes; elven runes and other symbols of power and immortality.
Several gardeners are present, putting in the many hours a garden of this
stature requires for its upkeep.

n
Path to the Throne
  Despite the castle being in severe disarray the reinforced entranceway to
the throne room remains whole, although nature's slow but relentless attacks
have left the stone bearing cracks and chips.  Two heavily guarded elven
soldiers stand by the door, preventing those who would harm the king access
to the room.  Large redwood doors stand as a final defense of the throne
room; they are easily five foot thick.

A Collapsed Throne Room
  A large hole has been torn out of the roofing of the throne room. 
However through luck or elven woodland magic, an entire tree has tilted and
grown directly into the hole to restore the castle's defenses.  The living
roof is covered with leaves, drawing their light from the torches that line
the walls here.  To the back of the room two large thrones of human design
sit.  This must have been a long abandoned (or conquered) castle.

n
Advisors' Table
  The advisors' room is dominated by a twenty foot long red oak table. 
Several elves walk around quickly here, bringing out maps and ancient battle
strategies to figure out how to route the orc invaders that will be on their
doorstep in a few short hours.  Bears, flaming arrows, and burning oil are
all being contemplated by the one elf who isn't running back and forth: The
King.  He slowly stands, his head bowed low in thought, and chooses to have
the mages begin the incantations to summon the wild animals of the forest to
their aid.  Perhaps nature, which broke this castle, can break a few orcs?

help pets
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Pets.
Help Category : Followers.
Related Helps : Charm person, Domination, Heel, Order.
Last Updated  : 2017-11-28 17:50:39.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax:  adopt <keyword>        : Adopt a pet from a pet store.
         adopt <keyword> <name> : Adopt a pet and give it a custom name.
         pets                   : Lists pets which are following you.
         nofollow <petname>     : Use nofollow to get rid of your pet.

You can only acquire a pet by using magic, a skill, or adopting low-level 
pets at the various pet stores around Andolor.  Pets will follow you and 
assist you when you fight. You may only have one pet at a time.

The 'PETS' command will show you which pets you have, and where they are.

To buy a pet in a pet shop, type 'list' to view the list of pets and then:
 
    adopt <keyword>        : Adopt a pet, using its default name.
    adopt <keyword> <name> : Adopt a pet, using a new name for it.

Note that pets are not allowed in most parts of Aylor, and that it is
usually not a good idea to bring a pet when you are on a quest.

Pets can do many things players can do.  Simply use 'order <pet> <command>'
to order a pet to do something.  Note that not all commands work with pets.

Pets can wear equipment, but only up to half their level and they cannot 
wear clan equipment. Just give the equipment to them, and order them to
wear it.  Beware! It is not recommended to give them equipment you care
about losing. If your pet lands a killing blow, the gold looted from the
mob will be lost.

To make a pet stop following you, type 'nofollow <name of pet>'.  To make
a pet stay where it is, order it to sleep/sit.  To make a pet return to 
you, use 'heel'. (This will not work in 'prison' flagged rooms.)

Pets only stay with you while you are in the game and will disappear when 
you quit.

If you are trying to use a social and see this command's output instead,
prefix the social with * to use the social.  See 'help socials'.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 509/573 HP  487/601 MP  801/802 mv  1080tnl  
Lv 19  G 60102 | Advisors' Table (S)
>>


help order
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Order.
Help Category : Followers.
Related Helps : Charm person, Domination, Pets.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-29 20:01:05.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: order <character> <command>
        order all <command>

'order' requests one or all of your charmed followers (including pets) to
perform any command.  The command may have arguments.  You are responsible
for the actions of your followers, and others who attack your followers
will incur the same penalty as if they attacked you directly.

Most charmed creatures lose their aggressive nature (while charmed).

Charmed creatures engaging in combat will break the charm.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

    adopt <keyword>        : Adopt a pet, using its default name.
    adopt <keyword> <name> : Adopt a pet, using a new name for it.

Path to the Throne
  Despite the castle being in severe disarray the reinforced entranceway to
the throne room remains whole, although nature's slow but relentless attacks
have left the stone bearing cracks and chips.  Two heavily guarded elven
soldiers stand by the door, preventing those who would harm the king access
to the room.  Large redwood doors stand as a final defense of the throne
room; they are easily five foot thick.

An Old Town Road

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Barren Fields (797)

On the outskirts of a battlefield
  Stepping through a small opening in the woodline, you find yourself
standing on the outer edge of what looks like a huge battlefield.  Your
mouth drops and you stare at the scene before you.  Chairs, tables, brooms,
and various other household items are fighting against animals!  How can
this be, though?  Furniture does not move and it certainly does not fight,
and even stranger is that the animals seem to be working together and using
makeshift weapons!

The staircase (795)

Richard's room
  This room is huge.  It is equal in size to the entire level of the tower
below this.  Apparently this room used to be some kind of ballroom or
banquet hall.  Richard is here running about the room, enchanting more
animals.  Two birds fly in carrying another bird and drop it in a cage
before taking off again.  Within minutes Richard has revived it, ensorcelled
it somehow, and is dictating to it its new duties.  Seemingly happy about
the new job, the little bird flies past you and down the stairs.  You can
make out a small trapdoor leading up to the top of the tower in the far
corner.

You climb up through the trapdoor.

The top of the tower
  Climbing up through the trapdoor, you find yourself standing on top of
the tower.  The wind is strong here and you become petrified with fear when
you realize there are no sides around the top of the tower.  It's just a
plain, flat top.  Suddenly a gust of wind blows you over and you cannot keep
your footing and go flying towards the edge of the tower!  Oh no, you will
fall to your death!  But wait, what's this?  You have landed in the air, as
if you are resting on a glass walkway.  Below you, you can see the
battlefield.  Shaken, your nerves shattered, you stand and cautiously test
the path east a bit more.  Seems sturdy enough so far....  

<MAPEND>

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G) [**>NOPK<**]
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Great Eastern Desert (749)

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

n
Entrance
  You stand in the shade of the temple entrance.  To the south the sun
blazes relentlessly onto the desert sand.  To the north lies the dark and
forbidding entrance to the temple.  From deep within the deserted catacombs
blows a slight breeze, as though the temple were breathing.  The air wafting
from the entrance smells of centuries of decay.  You wonder which is worse,
the hot blazing sun, or the stench of decay coming from within the
synagogue?

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G) [**>NOPK<**]
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Entrance
  You stand in the shade of the temple entrance.  To the south the sun
blazes relentlessly onto the desert sand.  To the north lies the dark and
forbidding entrance to the temple.  From deep within the deserted catacombs
blows a slight breeze, as though the temple were breathing.  The air wafting
from the entrance smells of centuries of decay.  You wonder which is worse,
the hot blazing sun, or the stench of decay coming from within the
synagogue?

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Entrance
  You stand in the shade of the temple entrance.  To the south the sun
blazes relentlessly onto the desert sand.  To the north lies the dark and
forbidding entrance to the temple.  From deep within the deserted catacombs
blows a slight breeze, as though the temple were breathing.  The air wafting
from the entrance smells of centuries of decay.  You wonder which is worse,
the hot blazing sun, or the stench of decay coming from within the
synagogue?

help group
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Group.
Help Category : Followers.
Related Helps : Autoassist, Autoshare, Disband, Follow, Policies6, Nogroup.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-29 19:03:11.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: group                 : Shows group stats (if in a group).
        group <character>     : Add a character to a group.
        group accept <leader> : Accept a group invite from <leader>
        group <option>        : See below for a list of more group options.
        

Grouping allows players within 15 levels of each other to join together to
share experience and rewards. Players in a group can usually take advantage
of each other's special abilities to kill faster and/or hunt larger targets
than they can handle solo. It can also just simply be more fun to hunt in a
group. 

Aardwolf allows you to create a group, flag the group as public or 
private, invite other players to join, reassign group leadership and 
track experience and kills over a period of time. 

Basic Grouping
==============

The basic version of grouping simply requires you to follow someone.
If they 'group' you, you will be added to their group. If they don't 
already have a group, one will be created. Once this has been done,
all of the options below are available.


Enhanced Grouping
==================

The 'group' command has multiple options based on whether or not you are
already in a group, and your status within the group:

Global Group Commands
---------------------

Group Create <Groupname> : Allows you to create a new group that you
  can then invite other players to join. 

Group Create <Groupname> private : Adding the 'private' option will 
  make your group invisible to others.

Group List: List all publicly visible groups and their level range.
  Using 'group list stats' shows the list with kills/exp values.

Group Rank [option]: Sorts the list of public groups in order of
  kills (option 1) or total exp (option 2)

Group Accept <Leader>: Accept a group invite from the given group leader.

Group Decline <Leader>: Decline a group invite from given group leader.

Group Invites: See any outstanding group invitations you have.


Group Member Commands
---------------------

Group Leave: Leave the group. If the person leaving is a group leader,
  a new leader will be automatically assigned. If the person leaving 
  is the last player in the group, the group will be disbanded.

Group Stats: Show the kills and total experience for each group member.
  Only kills occuring in the room with the group leader will update stats.

Group Stats Resetme: Reset your stats in this group.


Group Leader Commands
----------------------

Group Invite <Player>: Invite other players into the group.

Group Invited: View outstanding invitations for this group.

Group Cancel <Player>: Cancel an invitation previously made to a 
  player.

Group Kick <Player>: Kick a person out of the group.

Group Leader <Player>: Assign leadership to another group member.

Group Disband: Disband the group completely.

Group Stats Reset: Reset the group stats (group header stats only).

Group Rename: Rename the group to something else.

Group Flag [Public/Private]: Flag the group public or private. The
  default setting for groups that consist of more than one player is 
  public. Public groups that have more than one member can be seen by
  anyone in 'group list'. Private groups can only be seen by members 
  and people who have been invited to join the group.


Group Related Commands
----------------------

Other commands that are important while in a group are:

Gtell: Talk to other group members on the group channel. The semicolon
  is a shortcut for grouptell. 'Gtell -h' shows group history.

Share <amount>: Split <amount> of gold equally between group members.
  See also the 'autoshare' config option.

Autoassist: Toggles whether or not you will automatically join combat
  to assist your group leader.

Group Related Notes
-------------------

* A 'kill' is only counted when the group leader is in the room - 
  this is intentional. A kill is also only counted when it gives 
  experience - charging through newbie areas to rack up kill counts will
  not work.

* Following yourself no longer removes you from a group - use 'group
  leave' to leave a group completely.

* 'Nofollow' prevents people from directly following you - it does
  not stop someone from automatically following you if you add them to
  your group - presumably when you do this you *want* them to follow
  you. Nofollow is intended to prevent random followers.

* Cursing is prohibited in the group name if it is a public group.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some

Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G) [**>NOPK<**]
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Aeleron's Alchemy Supplies (G) [**>NOPK<**]
  This small stand is surrounded by an average sized fence, which has
only three openings to let customers into the shop.  The small fence
contains a vast number of cauldrons boiling and bubbling with liquids of
reds, blues, magentas, and greens.  Many signs sit everywhere, saying,
"Do not touch!",  "Leave it alone!",  and "Hands to Yourself!".
A small, old gnome stands on a step stool, busily pouring a bubbling gel
into a small flask.

(White Aura) A gray-haired, old gnome is enveloped in smoke as an attempt to bottle 'immolation'
goes awry.

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Entrance
  You stand in the shade of the temple entrance.  To the south the sun
blazes relentlessly onto the desert sand.  To the north lies the dark and
forbidding entrance to the temple.  From deep within the deserted catacombs
blows a slight breeze, as though the temple were breathing.  The air wafting
from the entrance smells of centuries of decay.  You wonder which is worse,
the hot blazing sun, or the stench of decay coming from within the
synagogue?

Entrance
  You stand in the shade of the temple entrance.  To the south the sun
blazes relentlessly onto the desert sand.  To the north lies the dark and
forbidding entrance to the temple.  From deep within the deserted catacombs
blows a slight breeze, as though the temple were breathing.  The air wafting
from the entrance smells of centuries of decay.  You wonder which is worse,
the hot blazing sun, or the stench of decay coming from within the
synagogue?

A long corridor
  You stand in a long dark corridor.  Dust and sand lie in drifts on the
floor, blown in by the desert wind.  Your footsteps echo hollowly from the
dark stone walls, or is there someone following you?  No, it's just an echo.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits

The Great Eastern Desert (749)

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Entrance
  You stand in the shade of the temple entrance.  To the south the sun
blazes relentlessly onto the desert sand.  To the north lies the dark and
forbidding entrance to the temple.  From deep within the deserted catacombs
blows a slight breeze, as though the temple were breathing.  The air wafting
from the entrance smells of centuries of decay.  You wonder which is worse,
the hot blazing sun, or the stench of decay coming from within the
synagogue?

Dusty Study
  You stand in a small, well-appointed study. Although most of the furnishings
are now quite decayed, you can tell they were once impressive. A large desk
dominates one side of the room, and you see a large tapestry on the east 
wall. Looking at it closely, you see it depicts some hellish landscape, with
grotesque beasts devouring hordes of humans, and performing perverse deeds
with naked women. The room contains little else of value, and the only exit
appears to be through the door to the north.

Priest's Quarters

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.

Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G) [**>NOPK<**]
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Vast Corridor (763)

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Into the dark (G)
  You have entered a room of nothingness; there is no sound, no breeze, no
sign of life whatsoever, just a large dark hole.  This hole is said to lead
to a world of eternal darkness that is sure to drive you mad if you wander

>>
Imperial Asteroid Field Fringe
  An asteroid field stretches almost as far as the eye can see across this
space, spanning many sectors.  Little, jagged lumps of rock float every
which place, poorly lit by the light of nearby stars, while dust forms a
haze around the larger asteroids, which look like floating mountains.  One
must be careful not to be crushed between them as they roll around and
bounce off of each other.  One of the asteroids here looks rather like a
spearhead.  

<MAPEND>

Silverwind Forest (778)

An Overgrown Forest Trail
  This once heavily used trail has slowly been reclaimed by the forest at
either side of it.  Even thousands of years have not allowed the forest to
entirely erase the trail, as faint traces of the magic that maintained the
trail are still present.  Tall grasses now grow, however the path is still
quite noticeable.

Aside from the Camp
  A small path leads out from the orc camp and winds through the plains
where the orcs have set up their temporary homes.  The grass is quite wild
in the plains, some places it reaches up to 3 or 4 feet.  After a few
minutes of walking along the path, you see off in the distance a tent, with
a large fire outside.  It appears to be another orc tent, but why is it so
far outside the camp?  

<MAPEND>

w
The WarBoss Tent
  Away from the total chaos in and around the orc camp, there sits a rather
large and well made tent.  It has been dyed grey and blue, and two stout
orcs stand guard.  Inside, the orc warboss sits in front of a large table,
looking at a crude drawing of the wood elf fortress.  He thrusts his dagger
into the map and sits to be entertained by his orc wenches.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Outskirts
  Breaking through the tree line, you come across an immense field.  Way
off in the distance you see what appears to be some type of tower.  However
it is like nothing you have ever seen before.  While the base appears to be
a mountain, layers have been transformed into different shapes as it rises
upwards disappearing into the clouds.  The adventurer's spirit within you is
aroused.  Sounds of fighting filter up to greet you.  An urge to practice
your new skills spurs you forward.

The staircase (765)

Richard's room
  This room is huge.  It is equal in size to the entire level of the tower
below this.  Apparently this room used to be some kind of ballroom or
banquet hall.  Richard is here running about the room, enchanting more
animals.  Two birds fly in carrying another bird and drop it in a cage
before taking off again.  Within minutes Richard has revived it, ensorcelled
it somehow, and is dictating to it its new duties.  Seemingly happy about
the new job, the little bird flies past you and down the stairs.  You can
make out a small trapdoor leading up to the top of the tower in the far
corner.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: down other ]
A duck flies overhead dropping stones on the animates.
Richard is here enchanting another animal for his army.
Richard is too busy enchanting animals and creating chaos to notice you
enter the room.

573/573 HP  569/601 MP  765/802 mv  2024tnl  
Lv 19  G 78887 | Richard's room (D*)
>>

------------------------------------------------------------
You climb up through the trapdoor.
------------------------------------------------------------
The top of the tower
  Climbing up through the trapdoor, you find yourself standing on top of
the tower.  The wind is strong here and you become petrified with fear when
you realize there are no sides around the top of the tower.  It's just a
plain, flat top.  Suddenly a gust of wind blows you over and you cannot keep
your footing and go flying towards the edge of the tower!  Oh no, you will
fall to your death!  But wait, what's this?  You have landed in the air, as
if you are resting on a glass walkway.  Below you, you can see the
battlefield.  Shaken, your nerves shattered, you stand and cautiously test
the path east a bit more.  Seems sturdy enough so far....  

<MAPEND>

The top of the tower
  Climbing up through the trapdoor, you find yourself standing on top of
the tower.  The wind is strong here and you become petrified with fear when
you realize there are no sides around the top of the tower.  It's just a
plain, flat top.  Suddenly a gust of wind blows you over and you cannot keep
your footing and go flying towards the edge of the tower!  Oh no, you will
fall to your death!  But wait, what's this?  You have landed in the air, as
if you are resting on a glass walkway.  Below you, you can see the
battlefield.  Shaken, your nerves shattered, you stand and cautiously test
the path west a bit more.  Seems sturdy enough so far....

has not been an easy target for the chaos Richard has unleashed."

       Wizards : Stop the warring wizards!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Stop the warring wizards!

The angel, Felicity says, "Do whatever it takes to stop this war and save the
land! This war has raged on since the king died years ago. Now, his two sons 
have been unable to decide who should rule. Rather than seeking a peaceful 
means to decide, Richard went on the offensive! His brother Virgil however, 
has not been an easy target for the chaos Richard has unleashed." 

Task 4  : Ask Richard about the Preservation Stone.

Virgil says, "The stone? Yes the stone..." Virgil says, "Our father made it 
for us before he died. He said the spells upon it would protect our lands 
from chaos. Now it is gone, Richard told me it was stolen. If you ask him 
maybe he will know more." Virgil says, "If he is in the mood to talk that 
is...."

Up in the air (797)

The black monolith
  A huge, jet black stone rises into the air here.  Standing at least
fifteen feet tall, it emanates a raw power that makes you shudder as it
courses through your body.  You fall to your knees, overcome with weakness
and fear.  Loathing fills your heart, and you suddenly wish to destroy every
last animal you see.  A huge figure straight from the tales of legend and
horror steps out before you.  Shaped like a man, this mottled grey creature
has rows of pointy teeth and is covered in sharp barbs.  The tips glisten
with a moisture and it grins an evil grin at you.  If you do not want to
fall victim to this demon's power, you had better act fast.  You can feel
your will slipping even now.

The top of the tower

you realize there are no sides around the top of the tower.  It's just a

fall to your death!  But wait, what's this?  You have landed in the air, as
if you are resting on a glass walkway.  Below you, you can see the
battlefield.  Shaken, your nerves shattered, you stand and cautiously test
the path east a bit more.  Seems sturdy enough so far....

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

On the outskirts of a battlefield
  Stepping through a small opening in the woodline, you find yourself
standing on the outer edge of what looks like a huge battlefield.  Your
mouth drops and you stare at the scene before you.  Chairs, tables, brooms,
and various other household items are fighting against animals!  How can
this be, though?  Furniture does not move and it certainly does not fight,
and even stranger is that the animals seem to be working together and using
makeshift weapons!

The staircase (795)

Richard's room
  This room is huge.  It is equal in size to the entire level of the tower
below this.  Apparently this room used to be some kind of ballroom or
banquet hall.  Richard is here running about the room, enchanting more
animals.  Two birds fly in carrying another bird and drop it in a cage
before taking off again.  Within minutes Richard has revived it, ensorcelled
it somehow, and is dictating to it its new duties.  Seemingly happy about
the new job, the little bird flies past you and down the stairs.  You can
make out a small trapdoor leading up to the top of the tower in the far
corner.

A duck flies overhead dropping stones on the animates.
Richard is here enchanting another animal for his army.
Richard looks at you indifferently as you enter the room.
Richard exclaims, "I have been expecting you, KumoGami! You spoke to
 him... Virgil. A... a little bird told me!"
Richard laughs.
Richard exclaims, "Well you caught me in a good mood! I just finished
 collapsing the eastern wing of Virgil's keep. I create this chaos just for
 the fun you know! I don't care if I become king or if my brother is gone
 or not!"
Richard almost giggles with delight.
Richard exclaims, "I told Virgil that powerless rock was stolen! It
 wasn't! I threw it in a boot!"
Richard asks, "Or was it a bucket?"
Richard exclaims, "Bah! It could be anywhere!"
Richard throws up his hands at you and goes back to work.

       Wizards : Stop the warring wizards!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Stop the warring wizards!

The angel, Felicity says, "Do whatever it takes to stop this war and save the
land! This war has raged on since the king died years ago. Now, his two sons 
have been unable to decide who should rule. Rather than seeking a peaceful 
means to decide, Richard went on the offensive! His brother Virgil however, 
has not been an easy target for the chaos Richard has unleashed." 

Task 5  : Find the Preservation Stone!

Richard exclaims, "I told Virgil that powerless rock was stolen! It wasn't!
I threw it in a boot!" Richard asks, "Or was it a bucket?" Richard exclaims, 
"Bah! It could be anywhere!"

Richard's room
  This room is huge.  It is equal in size to the entire level of the tower
below this.  Apparently this room used to be some kind of ballroom or
banquet hall.  Richard is here running about the room, enchanting more
animals.  Two birds fly in carrying another bird and drop it in a cage
before taking off again.  Within minutes Richard has revived it, ensorcelled
it somehow, and is dictating to it its new duties.  Seemingly happy about
the new job, the little bird flies past you and down the stairs.  You can
make out a small trapdoor leading up to the top of the tower in the far
corner.

On the outskirts of a battlefield
  A loud crackling noise grabs your attention and you quickly look upwards
to the top of the nearby tower.  A lone figure stands there, arms raised to
the clouds.  Swirling about, the clouds quickly gather in a large mass and
small jolts of lightning begin to fly out of it in various directions.

ground and a huge lightning bolt cracks through the sky, slamming into the
central sections of the battlefield, roasting many of the animated objects. 
Even from here the electricity makes your hair stand on end.

n
On the outskirts of a battlefield
  A loud crackling noise grabs your attention and you quickly look upwards
to the top of the nearby tower.  A lone figure stands there, arms raised to
the clouds.  Swirling about, the clouds quickly gather in a large mass and
small jolts of lightning begin to fly out of it in various directions. 
Suddenly, with a loud shout, the figure throws his arms down towards the
ground and a huge lightning bolt cracks through the sky, slamming into the
central sections of the battlefield, roasting many of the animated objects. 
Even from here the electricity makes your hair stand on end.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south ]
A hardened glass plate spins in the air like a saw blade.
A fat bee buzzes through the air on its way to sting a chair.
A fuzzy hamster tries like mad to make a difference.

probably to roost.

>>
At the stairs
  Emerging from the collapsing hallways, you wipe your forehead and release
a sigh of relief.  This place is as bad as Virgil's.  Both towers are on the
verge of collapse after so many months of constant battle.  You notice some
stairs here that seem to go both up and down, as well as collapsing hallways
leading off in all directions.  Unsure of which way to go, you place your
hand on the railing of the stairs and immediately draw it back.  Bird poop
covers this place, along with droppings of every other kind of animal that
has been in the immediate vicinity.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
A pointy-nosed shrew sniffs the air with its delicate nose.

e
e
A destroyed hallway
  You pick your way through the stone rubble, trying to work your way
farther inside.  Richard cannot possibly be as mad as all of this makes him
appear to be.  Can he?  An intersection looms ahead; perhaps you can locate
someone who talks around here.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
