573/573 HP  601/601 MP  802/802 mv  570tnl  
Lv 19  G 79208 | A destroyed hallway (EW)
>>
e
e
Just inside the Tower
  Finally you have made it to Richard's tower.  You were worried traveling
through the battlefield with so much fighting raging on around you, but
neither the animals nor the enchanted goods seemed interested in you. 
Stepping just inside of the tower, you can see that this tower used to
actually be part of a castle.  Now, however, it is only shambled remains of
its former glory.  The floors and walls are covered in animal feces and
cracks run the length of the room, worrying you that at any time this whole
place may come down on top of you.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
A grey mole is here digging out a pit trap with its huge feet.
This dragonfly is whizzing here and there, hovering in the air.

573/573 HP  601/601 MP  802/802 mv  570tnl  
Lv 19  G 79208 | Just inside the Tower (EW)
>>
Before the Tower
  Standing outside of Richard's tower, you dodge from side to side, trying
desperately to avoid the oncoming rush of animals as they scurry and run to
and from the tower.  Looking upwards, you see that the tower rises up at
least fifty feet into the air.  Once, this tower must have been beautiful,
majestic.  Now, however, it is only an eyesore in ruins.  

<MAPEND>

A silver-backed badger growls and snarls defiantly.

u
Richard's room
  This room is huge.  It is equal in size to the entire level of the tower
below this.  Apparently this room used to be some kind of ballroom or
banquet hall.  Richard is here running about the room, enchanting more
animals.  Two birds fly in carrying another bird and drop it in a cage
before taking off again.  Within minutes Richard has revived it, ensorcelled
it somehow, and is dictating to it its new duties.  Seemingly happy about
the new job, the little bird flies past you and down the stairs.  You can
make out a small trapdoor leading up to the top of the tower in the far
corner.

The top of the tower
  Climbing up through the trapdoor, you find yourself standing on top of
the tower.  The wind is strong here and you become petrified with fear when
you realize there are no sides around the top of the tower.  It's just a
plain, flat top.  Suddenly a gust of wind blows you over and you cannot keep
your footing and go flying towards the edge of the tower!  Oh no, you will
fall to your death!  But wait, what's this?  You have landed in the air, as
if you are resting on a glass walkway.  Below you, you can see the
battlefield.  Shaken, your nerves shattered, you stand and cautiously test
the path east a bit more.  Seems sturdy enough so far....  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east other ]
A whippoorwill keeps an eye out for danger as it chirps its namesake.
A wooden coat hanger floats in the air and threatens to hit you.

------------------------------------------------------------
You climb down through the trapdoor.
------------------------------------------------------------
Richard's room
  This room is huge.  It is equal in size to the entire level of the tower
below this.  Apparently this room used to be some kind of ballroom or
banquet hall.  Richard is here running about the room, enchanting more
animals.  Two birds fly in carrying another bird and drop it in a cage
before taking off again.  Within minutes Richard has revived it, ensorcelled
it somehow, and is dictating to it its new duties.  Seemingly happy about
the new job, the little bird flies past you and down the stairs.  You can
make out a small trapdoor leading up to the top of the tower in the far
corner.  

<MAPEND>

At the stairs
  Emerging from the collapsing hallways, you wipe your forehead and release
a sigh of relief.  This place is as bad as Virgil's.  Both towers are on the
verge of collapse after so many months of constant battle.  You notice some
stairs here that seem to go both up and down, as well as collapsing hallways
leading off in all directions.  Unsure of which way to go, you place your
hand on the railing of the stairs and immediately draw it back.  Bird poop
covers this place, along with droppings of every other kind of animal that
has been in the immediate vicinity.

w
Guest room
  This room was probably a guest room at one time.  It has nice dimensions
but is not overly large.  If it were a smaller room it would be servants'
quarters.  If it were larger it would have been a master's bedroom.  As it
is now, you will just have to use your best guess as to what it really was
since all of the furnishings have long since been animated from here.

d
At the stairs
  Emerging from the collapsing hallways, you wipe your forehead and release
a sigh of relief.  This place is as bad as Richard's.  Both towers are on
the verge of collapse after so many months of constant battle.  You notice
some stairs here that seem to go both up and down, as well as collapsing
hallways leading off in all directions, though the stairs draw your
attention at the moment.  Looking up, you can see a large platform fastened
to one side of the stairwell.  It appears to be some sort of rigged pulley
system.  It is probably used to get furniture down to the ground floor,
though you can see the guides for the platform run down to what you think is
the cellar as well.

The top of the tower
  Climbing up through the trapdoor, you find yourself standing on top of
the tower.  The wind is strong here and you become petrified with fear when
you realize there are no sides around the top of the tower.  It's just a
plain, flat top.  Suddenly a gust of wind blows you over and you cannot keep
your footing and go flying towards the edge of the tower!  Oh no, you will
fall to your death!  But wait, what's this?  You have landed in the air, as
if you are resting on a glass walkway.  Below you, you can see the
battlefield.  Shaken, your nerves shattered, you stand and cautiously test
the path west a bit more.  Seems sturdy enough so far....

The top of the tower
  Climbing up through the trapdoor, you find yourself standing on top of
the tower.  The wind is strong here and you become petrified with fear when
you realize there are no sides around the top of the tower.  It's just a
plain, flat top.  Suddenly a gust of wind blows you over and you cannot keep
your footing and go flying towards the edge of the tower!  Oh no, you will
fall to your death!  But wait, what's this?  You have landed in the air, as
if you are resting on a glass walkway.  Below you, you can see the
battlefield.  Shaken, your nerves shattered, you stand and cautiously test
the path east a bit more.  Seems sturdy enough so far....

The black monolith
  A huge, jet black stone rises into the air here.  Standing at least
fifteen feet tall, it emanates a raw power that makes you shudder as it
courses through your body.  You fall to your knees, overcome with weakness
and fear.  Loathing fills your heart, and you suddenly wish to destroy every
last animal you see.  A huge figure straight from the tales of legend and
horror steps out before you.  Shaped like a man, this mottled grey creature
has rows of pointy teeth and is covered in sharp barbs.  The tips glisten
with a moisture and it grins an evil grin at you.  If you do not want to
fall victim to this demon's power, you had better act fast.  You can feel
your will slipping even now.  

<MAPEND>

and you fall to your knees weeping as every thought of injustice and

wiping the tears from your eyes, she pulls you to your feet and wraps her
wings about you in a comforting embrace of compassion.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Walk of the Stars - Vespera
  Crimson light, like the ruddy hue of an unseen sunset, winds around these
stars.  And yet, unlike the Zenith trail, it does not seem malevolent, but
restful.  The path it takes runs from Kitalpha, past the moongate, then
north, parallel to Moonwalk until it reaches Kursa, and goes around Sham and
Tseen Kee on its way to Okda, and finally south to complete the loop.  Tseen
Kee, Sham and Kursa form a triangle to the northwest, while Saiph is off in
the southeast.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The staircase (812)

Guest room
  This room was probably a guest room at one time.  It has nice dimensions
but is not overly large.  If it were a smaller room it would be servants'
quarters.  If it were larger it would have been a master's bedroom.  As it
is now, you will just have to use your best guess as to what it really was
since all of the furnishings have long since been animated from here.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]
A magical broomstick is flying through the air; maybe you can catch it.
A nice blue shirt beckons you to wear it.
A lovely antique rocking chair slowly rocks back and forth.
Some bats swoop over the area harassing the animates.
A wooden-handled skillet floats in the air.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

The Great Eastern Desert (803)

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.  

<MAPEND>

Intersection
  You have arrived at a four-way intersection.  To the east the smell of
decay seems stronger, and a chill seems to emanate from the very walls.  A
sense of ancient evil pervades the air all around you, raising the hairs on
the back of your neck.  To the south the air seems slightly cooler and more
moist, and to the east lies nothing but darkness.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

A crack in the valley floor
  The valley you travel through is marred by an opening caused by a
recent earthquake.  The sun casts trails of light that reach deep in
the opening illuminating what appears to be mason work.  Looking in,
you can see that the sides of the crevasse form a rough staircase

Vast Corridor (783)

A Broken Corridor
  The smoothness of the tunnel walls has been destroyed.  Peering through
the inky blackness, one may detect an opening to the west, and a mound of
freshly dug earth to either side of it.  Mud bricks have been baked to
flinty hardness and laid to support the hole in the wall, preventing
collapse.  As one nears the opening, a little light can be glimpsed.

A Guard Outpost
  A rough tunnel has been burrowed through the dark brown earth, large
enough for even giants to pass through easily.  It'd be a lot easier if
there weren't a new iron-banded wooden gate in the way though.  The pair of
giant... holy cow, those are rabbits!  Six feet tall when they sit on their
haunches, they're also armed to the teeth.  And they're glaring at you.

A Back Alley
  Very little light reaches in to this narrow alley. What little there is, 
casts shadows that seem to move of their own will. Cannisters of trash lie 
knocked over, their contents strewn across the tunnel floor. The alley feels 
dangerous, and few rabbits would enter here, unless they are up to no good.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

help animal friendship
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Animal Friendship'.
Help Category : Followers.
Related Helps : Dust Devil, Resurrection, Charm person.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-11 22:23:26.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax:  cast 'animal friendship' <victim>
Spell Number: 138

By the use of skilled body language, charisma, odours, and a touch
of magic, the Ranger is able to bring an animal under their control,
so that it will follow their will. A mob charmed using this method 
will obey you faithfully for the duration of the spell.

Primary stat: Wisdom, Constitution.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Lv 20  G 80328 | Mudpits (EWD)

  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you

enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

A Broken Corridor

the inky blackness, one may detect an opening to the west, and a mound of
freshly dug earth to either side of it.  Mud bricks have been baked to

604/604 HP  525/627 MP  820/820 mv  342tnl  
Lv 20  G 80385 | A Dark and Foreboding Corridor (EW)
>>*[NOEXP]* 
WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>*[NOEXP]* 
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

On the outskirts of a battlefield
  Stepping through a small opening in the woodline, you find yourself
standing on the outer edge of what looks like a huge battlefield.  Your
mouth drops and you stare at the scene before you.  Chairs, tables, brooms,
and various other household items are fighting against animals!  How can
this be, though?  Furniture does not move and it certainly does not fight,
and even stranger is that the animals seem to be working together and using
makeshift weapons!

w
On the outskirts of a battlefield
  A loud crackling noise grabs your attention and you quickly look upwards
to the top of the nearby tower.  A lone figure stands there, arms raised to
the clouds.  Swirling about, the clouds quickly gather in a large mass and
small jolts of lightning begin to fly out of it in various directions. 
Suddenly, with a loud shout, the figure throws his arms down towards the
ground and a huge lightning bolt cracks through the sky, slamming into the
central sections of the battlefield, roasting many of the animated objects. 
Even from here the electricity makes your hair stand on end.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)

in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Deep Jungle (760)

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..

At the Mouth of a Cave (G)
  The path that you followed has led you to an uninviting cave.  It is dark
and eerie, your judgement tells you that it is not wise to proceed further. 
In the distance you hear the faint sounds of screams and swords slashing. 
Wondering what could be happening ahead you decide to continue into the cave
and explore.

Deeper Within the Cavern (797)

Underground Valley
  The light at the end of the tunnel!!  You feel so relieved after being
cramped up in the caverns.  You must be getting closer to the Citadel.  From
a distance, you can hear the warcries and clashing of swords..  Turning your
head towards the sounds, you come upon a small valley that has been burned
down by fighting.  You step closer to the burning bushes and trees and
hear the sounds grow stronger.  You must be close to the battlefield!

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Deep Jungle (759)

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..

At the Mouth of a Cave (G)

and eerie, your judgement tells you that it is not wise to proceed further. 
In the distance you hear the faint sounds of screams and swords slashing.

and explore.

Underground Valley

cramped up in the caverns.  You must be getting closer to the Citadel.  From
a distance, you can hear the warcries and clashing of swords..  Turning your

down by fighting.  You step closer to the burning bushes and trees and
hear the sounds grow stronger.  You must be close to the battlefield!

close down;lock down
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

Infirmary (G)
  Oh no it looks like the perils of Aardwolf have overcome you and you have 
fallen in battle. No worries though it looks like your fellow soldiers were 
able to recover your body and resurrect your spirit. It's a strange feeling 
seeing your body on the ground. IMPORTANT: Make sure you loot everything 
off your corpse and it decomposes before you leave the room! Sometimes
you might have issues seeing the invisible objects on your corpse. You can 
buy a detect invisibility potion from our shop run s3e from here and type 
list. Also don't be afraid to ask for a miracle on clantalk. If it works 
it could help restore some of your lost experience. The Medical Lounge is 
south from here in case you need a healer.

<MAPEND>

d
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Lv 20  G 80445 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>*[NOEXP]* 
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

345/604 HP  525/627 MP  818/820 mv  1585tnl  
Lv 20  G 80445 | The Grand City of Aylor (NESWUD)
>>*[NOEXP]* 
Whitewind Avenue (G) (818)

Entrance to the Crusader Clan Temple (G)
  It takes you only a few seconds to realise that this is no ordinary temple 
building. There is a constant flow in and out of the temple of people and 
goods. As you watch, a shipment of shining white plate armor is carted into 
the temple doors. Not long after, a group of noble knights exit the temple 
accompanied by the blare of trumpets to honor the start of a new crusade 
against evil. You notice a friendly knight standing near the large arch 
leading into the temple who appears to be directing all newcomers to various 
sections of the temple. You are convinced that your stay here will be a 
blessed one.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     A small campfire burns merrily away here.
Cedric leans comfortably against a sign with directions around the temple.

345/604 HP  525/627 MP  818/820 mv  1585tnl

>>*[NOEXP]* 
n
The Marble Hallway (G)
  As you look around the hall, you notice the finely crafted walls of white 
marble. Within the patterns of the opaque stone you glimpse images of past 
Crusaders. They seem to be speaking words of truth and wisdom to you. As you 
near the end of the hallway you wonder what strange power dwells in this 
place. Perhaps it is simply a figment of your imagination, brought on by the 
sacred aura that fills these corridors.

Up: Shops
Down: Services

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Lv 20  G 80445 | The Marble Hallway (NESWUD)
>>*[NOEXP]* 
u
The Shadowed Hall
  You have entered the Marketplace.  To your left you notice a 
room full of young knights in search of their first set of equipment.  
To your right stands a tall proud knight offering a more sophisticated list 
of armour.  Straight across the hall ahead of you is another experienced 
knight honing a set of fine weapons.  Perhaps investigating these rooms 
further will allow you to find what you are seeking.

North - Weaponry
East - Armoury
South - Traveling Supplies
West - New Squire's equipment

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west down ]

345/604 HP  525/627 MP  817/820 mv  1585tnl  
Lv 20  G 80445 | The Shadowed Hall (NESWD)
>>*[NOEXP]* 
n
The Temple Weaponry
  As you step into the Temple Weaponry, you take notice of the remarkable items
displayed before you. The floor is worn and scuffed by the wear of time and 
the many travellers come and gone. Weapons of the finest quality have been 
set on display, while the Weaponry's caretaker Sir William is busy sharpening
another strong blade. Each item has been designed and honed to perfection.
The Crusaders take great care to ensure the quality and holy power of each 
weapon. Sir William pauses in his work and looks over to you with a 
half-hearted smile, then beckons you to look closer at each selection.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south ]
Sir William looks up as you enter the room and politely offers assistance.

vc
-vconfig-  seperate multiple commands with | instead of ;

  -  [port]    Recall portal to use                     hold duffle;enter
  -  [wield]   Wielded weapon to use                    bow
  -  [dual]    Dual wielded weapon to use               bow
  -  [held]    Held item to return after using portals  candle
  -  [spellup] Spellup to use                           napalm;spellup
  -  [hpot]    Health potion to use                     relief
  -  [mpot]    Mana potion to use                       moonlight
  -  [vpot]    Moves potion to use                      refreshing
  -  [pbag]    Potions bag                              bag
  -  [portbag] Portals bag                              bag
  -  [bag]     General bag                              bag
  -  [attack1] Primary attack                           c moonbeam
  -  [attack2] Secondary attack                         kick
  -  [debuff1] First debuff                             ca weaken
  -  [debuff2] Second debuff                            ca wither
  -  [cplvl]   Level to CP level until                  110
  -  [cpexp]   CP Level noexp toggle amount             400
  -  [group]   Group Frame Format until                 1
  -  [tdiff]   Time Difference from Mud Time            7
  -  [speak]   Speak audio alerts                       false

The Reception Hall
  You gaze in amazement at what used to be an ornate hotel.  A chandelier
creaks alarmingly overhead.  To the west is a large dark room.  To the east
is a closed door with a sign.  Behind a pink and grey marble counter, a
skeleton slumps against the wall, seeming to want to talk to you.  Straight
ahead to the north is a long hall; you can't quite see to the end of it.

n
Rotunda
  This room has eight sides, with three of them stained glass.  At least
you think it is stained glass until you notice that the stain seems to be
blood.  Through double glass doors to the west you see a garden type area. 
By looking under some swinging half doors to the east, it looks like a
restaurant.  A wide banister made of mahogany with wide steps covered with
nearly threadbare carpet lead up into the darkness, spiraling so that you
can't see the top.  Straight ahead, the hallway continues.  

<MAPEND>

>>*[NOEXP]* 
Middle of the Hall
  This is a wide hall stretching to the north with the rotunda to the
south.  To the east and west are doors to guest rooms.  You tread on the
carpet lightly, yet still cause noxious black clouds of mold spores to puff
up with each step.  You fancy you can hear an argument going on to the east.
To the west you can hear what sounds like maniacal laughter and a second
voice pleading.  

<MAPEND>

381/604 HP  573/627 MP  808/820 mv  1585tnl  
Lv 20  G 77755 | Rotunda (NESWU)
>>*[NOEXP]* 
u


Top Floor Landing
  You made it up those squeaking stairs, now what?  There is a door in each
direction and a trapdoor in the ceiling.  The landing here is fairly plain,
and you think that any guests up here shouldn't have to pay as much.  The
room to the south has a sign saying Blue Room.  The one to the north says
Rubber Room.  The rooms to the east and west have no signs at all.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (north) (east) (south) (west) up down ]
A transparent rat, trailing vapor, scuttles around the edges of the room.

Lv 20  G 77755 | Top Floor Landing ([N][E][S][W]UD)
>>*[NOEXP]* 
u
Attic
  You've found an attic.  You hadn't realized how large the floor beneath
was.  The attic stretches in all directions, with irregular shapes and odd
nooks.  As well, there are all kinds of curious stuff and outright junk
scattered and piled everwhere.  To the north, you can make out a dirty
window, and there's a skylight above your head.  

<MAPEND>

A waiter taps your shoulder and asks if you would like a drink.

A ghostly figure is here, leaning through the bar, holding a glass of something.
An albino cockroach flees from the light!

>>*[NOEXP]* 
On A Pinnacle
  You balance precariously on a small ledge around the skylight.  There is
a lightning rod here with a weather vane on top of that.  You can see over
the edges of the steep roof on all sides.  The ground looks a long way off
and a fall would be fatal.  Worse, you seem to have disturbed birds and they
are flying around you, trying to get you to leave.

eqsearch
Syntax: eqsearch all         - show all wear locs with a better item.
      : eqsearch <item>      - compare searchable equipment to item.
      : eqsearch <wear loc>  - find searchable equipment in wear loc.

See 'help eqsearch' for full compare syntax and options.

Lv 20  G 77839 | On A Pinnacle (D)

        option that makes an item not count towards your item limit.

Attic
  You've found an attic.  You hadn't realized how large the floor beneath
was.  The attic stretches in all directions, with irregular shapes and odd
nooks.  As well, there are all kinds of curious stuff and outright junk
scattered and piled everwhere.  To the north, you can make out a dirty
window, and there's a skylight above your head.

A ghostly figure is here, leaning through the bar, holding a glass of something.
An albino cockroach flees from the light!

191/604 HP  446/627 MP  820/820 mv  1341tnl

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

w
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.

help aarditems
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Quest Items' 'Quest Equipment' Aarditems.
Help Category : Information.
Related Helps : QP, Quest, Reimbursement.
Last Updated  : 2019-03-25 15:35:39.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This help file lists the costs and standard stats of the various Aardwolf
quest equipment, as well as their standard and level-based stats.

All quest equipment remains at the level it is purchased; the variable
components of the items are based upon the level the item is purchased but
do not change.  The two exceptions are the Decanter (always level 1) and
the Bag of Aardwolf (always the current carrier's level).

Weapons  
(Cost: 1000qp  Resell: 500qp  Weight: Varies  Worn: wield)
Variable:   Avg Damage: 2.5 * level if 1-79, 3 * level if 80 or higher.
            Hitroll/damroll: Level / 10 , minimum of 5.

   Each weapon uses a different weapon skill and has its own default
   damage, weight, and weapon flag:

        Weapon    Skill     Damage Type    Flag       Wght
        Axe       Axe       Cleave         Vorpal      20
        Bow       Bow       Thwack         Changing    20
        Dagger    Dagger    Pierce         Sharp       10
        Flail     Flail     Beating        Vampiric    25
        Halberd   Polearm   Drain          Changing    25
        Mace      Mace      Pound          Frost       20
        Staff     Spear     Thwack         Shocking    15
        Sword     Sword     Slice          Flaming     35
        Whip      Whip      Shocking Bite  Vampiric    15
-------------------------------------------------------------------------   

Shield  
(Cost: 750qp  Resell: 500qp  Weight: 25  Worn: shield)
Static:     +5 Strength.
Variable:   Hitroll/Damroll: Level / 5, minimum 5.
            Resistances: All physical and all magical, variable by
            level.  (Use 'quest appraise' for values at your level.)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Aura of Sanctuary  
(Cost: 2500qp  Resell: 2000qp  Weight: 1  Worn: float)
Static:     +100 hp, +50 mana, +200 moves.
            +3 Dexterity (on top of level-based stats).
            Permanent, undispellable sanctuary effect when worn.
Variable:   Bonus to all six stats, 1 + (level / 50, rounded down)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Amulet of Aardwolf  
(Cost: 750qp  Weight: 4  Worn: hold (portal with wish))
Static:     +2 to all six stats.
            Portal to the Aardwolf Hotel, with enhanced healing, questor,
            and area exits.            
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Bracers of Iron Grip  
(Cost: 1750qp  Weight: 5  Worn: arms- NOT wrist)
Static:      Cannot be disarmed while bracers are worn.
Variable:    Hitroll/Damroll: Level / 5, minimum 5.
             HP/mana: Equal to level of purchasing player, minimum 50.
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Gloves of Dexterity  
(Cost: 2250qp  Weight: 10  Worn: hands)
Static:      +6 Dexterity.
             100% Dual Wield skill, regardless of class.  All other
               restrictions apply; see 'help dual wield'.
Variable:    HP/mana/moves:  Level of purchasing player, minimum 50.
             Hitroll/Damroll: Level / 5, minimum 5.
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Boots of Speed  
(Cost: 1300qp  Weight: 2  Worn: feet)
Static:      Hitroll/Damroll: +10.
             HP: +75.
             +3 Dexterity, +2 Luck.
             Permanent haste affect when worn.
Variable:    Resistances: Varies by level.  Use 'quest appraise' to see
             resists at current level.
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Wings of Aardwolf  
(Cost: 800qp  Weight: 1  Worn: back)
Static:      +2 Wisdom, +2 Constitution, +3 Dexterity.
             Permanent flying affect when worn.
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Ring of Invisibility  
(Cost: 500qp  Weight: 1  Worn: finger)
Static:      HP/mana/moves: +30.
             Adds invisibility affect when worn.  Remove and re-equip to
             reset effect (after going visible or starting a fight, etc.)
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Ring of Regeneration  
(Cost: 1000qp  Resell: 700qp  Weight: 1  Worn: finger)
Static:      Hitroll/Damroll: +12
             Enhanced healing when worn.
Variable:    Stats: 1 + (Level / 30, rounded down) points in random stats.
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Helm of True Sight  
(Cost: 1100qp  Resell: 700qp  Weight: 5  Worn: head)
Static:      HP: +45.
             Hitroll/Damroll: +8.
             Permanent detect good/evil/hidden/invis/magic while worn.
Variable:    Luck: 1 + (level / 20, rounded down).
             Resistances: Varies by level.  Use 'quest appraise' to see
             resists at current level.
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Breastplate of Magic Resistance  
(Cost: 2000qp  Weight: 10  Worn: torso)
Static:      HP/mana/moves: +125.
             +2 to all six stats.
             Resists: +100 to all magic except disease/poison.
Variable:    Hitroll/Damroll: Level / 5, minimum 5.
             Resistances: Physical resistances vary by level.  Use 'quest
             appraise' to see resists at current level.
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Decanter of Endless Water  
(Cost: 550qp  Weight: 5  Worn: none)

  Once filled, the Decanter will almost never run dry (but can be poured
  out if you want to fill it with something different). Decanters are
  always level 1, regardless of level when purchasing it.
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Bag of Aardwolf  
(Cost: 1500qp  Resell: 1000qp  Weight: Varies  Worn: none)
Static:      Heaviest item: 100.
             Weight multiplier:  20%.
Variable:    Weight: -50 - (current carrier level * 2).
             Capacity: 1000 + (20 * current carrier level).

  The Bag of Aardwolf changes stats based upon the person carrying it.  It
  automatically changes to your level.  A bag with higher stats bought off
  rauction will be calculated to your level; it will not retain the level
  201 stats shown on 'rbid'.

  Once you have reached level 201 and remorted, your aard bags will
  stay at level 201 but Tiers won't get the full benefit of bag over level
  201 until they reach the appropriate level.
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
ObjLower  
(Cost: 500qp per use)

  See 'help objlower'.
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
ObjStat:  
(Cost: 500qp per use)

  See 'help objstat'.
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
IMPORTANT:  Please read 'help reimbursement' for details in what
happens should you lose a quest item, and the circumstances in which they
can and can not be reimbursed.

Please note: The questor does not buy back bracers, gloves, boots, wings,
rings of invisibility, breastplates, decanters, or amulets.

There are also videos which show more info on quest items in Aardwolf:

The Bag of Aardwolf :         http://youtu.be/spCr4SJmvCM
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

604/604 HP  627/627 MP  820/820 mv  1341tnl  
Lv 20  G 77839 | Medical lounge (E[D])
>>
help newbie-aarditems
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Newbie-Aarditems.
Help Category : newhelp.
Related Helps : Quest items, Newguide-quests, Quest, Quest Points.
Last Updated  : 2018-11-12 17:25:46.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Type 'quest list' at any questor to see the list of Aard items for sale. 
Don't sit at level 1 to save up quest points. Every time you remort you 
return to level 1, so just pick up however much eq you can afford as you 
run through the levels. The list below gives a skeleton of useful 
purchases. The level you buy at is EXTREMELY important.

Level 1
*Aura of Sanctuary
 Gloves of Dexterity
*Breastplate of Magic Resistance
 Bracers of Iron Grip
 Helm of True Sight
 Boots of Speed
 Wings
 Amulet
 Ring of Invisibility
 Ring of Regeneration

Level 100
 Breastplate of Magic Resistance
 Bracers
 Gloves

Level 150
 Breastplate of Magic Resistance

Level 200
 Breastplate of Magic Resistance
 Aura of Sanctuary
 Bracers
 Gloves

Level 251
 Breastplate of Magic Resistance
 Aura of Sanctuary (optimal time for stats - equivalent to a 291 aura)
 Bracers
 Gloves
 
*Possible items to prioritize

Weapons

High level mobs are tougher to kill so buy weapons first at the highest 
level, then move down the list until you eventually reach the lowest level
weapons. This makes leveling easier!
 
170 is probably the highest level weapon you will need. You might be 
considering a level 180 weapon, but keep in mind that as a newbie the 
bracers/gloves/breastplate will be more useful because at level 186 you can
ask on the wangrp channel for a drag ('help newbie-drag'). So the level
180 weapon is in fact only useful for 6 levels.
 
80 is usually the lowest level weapon you want to get because at that level 
there is a change to the average damage of quest weapons: avg Damage: 2.5 *
level if 1-79, 3 * level if 80 or higher.
 
Consider getting axes and daggers since their weight allows for dual 
wielding. 

However, make sure that you can use the weapon that you purchase. You
will often pick up the axe skill as you remort, if you don't start with it,
so you may want to purchase daggers first if you don't have the axe skill.

First get axes and dual wield with a weapon from a clan store:
 170 Axe of Aardwolf
 150 Axe of Aardwolf
 130 Axe of Aardwolf
 90  Axe of Aardwolf
 
Once you've gathered enough quest points fill in the gaps:
 160 Dagger of Aardwolf
 140 Dagger of Aardwolf
 120 Dagger of Aardwolf
 110 Axe of Aardwolf
 100 Dagger of Aardwolf
 
This way you can always dual wield two quest weapons:
 At 90: wield axe
 At 100: wield 90 level axe with dual 100 dagger
 At 110: wield 110 level axe with dual 100 dagger and so on. 
 
Eventually you may want to get weapons level 80 and below, but keep in mind
that clan weapons are 'good enough' in range 1-90.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..  

<MAPEND>

At the Mouth of a Cave (G)
  The path that you followed has led you to an uninviting cave.  It is dark
and eerie, your judgement tells you that it is not wise to proceed further. 
In the distance you hear the faint sounds of screams and swords slashing. 
Wondering what could be happening ahead you decide to continue into the cave
and explore.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Entrance to the Canyon Memorial Hospital
  Before you is a two story building made almost entirely of ice.  The cold 
wasteland surrounding it looks very forbidding.  A large sign in the center 
of the building proclaims Canyon Memorial Hospital.  Smaller signs are hung 
to the left and right of the large triple doors.  The door in the middle is 
much wider than the other two.

Surgical Waiting Room
  This large icy room is filled with chairs.  It appears that this room has
not been reorganized in some time.  A tiny group of chairs has been circled
together in one corner.  Newsprint and magazines were placed in a seemingly
random fashion amongst the chairs.  None seem to have been read, but rather
just used to keep track of time.  A large clock stands against the wall and
seems to show the current time.

The Pharmacy (G)
  This room appears to be lit a bit better.  A small sign hangs on the wall
showing a single number, which will be waited on next.  A half door divides
the wall which separates the two halves of this room.  The top half is open
and the quiet pharmacist blocks most of the opening hiding your view from
the various bottles and potions behind him.

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north up ]

and eerie, your judgement tells you that it is not wise to proceed further.

Underground Valley

cramped up in the caverns.  You must be getting closer to the Citadel.  From
a distance, you can hear the warcries and clashing of swords..  Turning your

down by fighting.  You step closer to the burning bushes and trees and
hear the sounds grow stronger.  You must be close to the battlefield!

Before the Fabled City
  The City of Stone looms ahead of you.  The towering stone monuments of
the city contrast with the luscious green of your immediate surroundings.  It
appears majestic, the simple curves of the stone buildings reflect the
sunset slightly, creating an almost eerie feeling.  From this distance you
can't see any movement or life inside the city.  Wondering if the city will
be as quiet and serene inside its walls as it appears from here, you
continue on your journey.  

<MAPEND>

Castle Gates
  You get the perfect opportunity to admire the beauty of the Citadel as
you stand at the gates.  The walls are built of many different stones and
gems, creating a glorious pattern across the surface.  The citadel seems to
glow as the sun shines and glints on the polished surface.  You cannot even
imagine how much time it must have taken to build such an amazing building. 
Before coming to the Stone City you had heard many stories of the Citadel's
beauty, but still you did not expect to find a building as magical and
enchanting as this.

  Warm rays of sunlight stream through the tall trees surrounding the stone
coutyard.  In the centre there is a majestic fountain, intricately carved
out of stone with details of amethyst, garnet and diamond.  Ferns and
flowering shrubs brighten up the courtyard and create homes for buzzing
insects and small birds.  The atmosphere is so peaceful here, you feel as if
you could forget all about your mission and spend the rest of your life in
this tranquil place.

Guard Room [**> PK <**]
  The guard room is small and crowded.  The walls and low ceiling are
covered with a texture of small pebbles of many different colours, stuck
tightly together.  You feel uncomfortable in the hot room and damp air.

moment.  Your mind returns to the tall guards standing in the room, and you
decide to leave as soon as possible, it is not safe to be here.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Deep Jungle (760)

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..  

<MAPEND>

Stone Archway
  You find yourself at the very gates of the of this fabled city.  You gasp
as you realize that you have finally arrived at this city you once thought
only existed in rumors and fairy tales.  To the north of the gate you hear
the bustling sounds of its inhabitants.  You can hardly wait to meet them
and explore!  

<MAPEND>

Stone Avenue Square (788)

Stone Avenue (787)

Stone Avenue (786)

Castle Gates
  You get the perfect opportunity to admire the beauty of the Citadel as
you stand at the gates.  The walls are built of many different stones and
gems, creating a glorious pattern across the surface.  The citadel seems to
glow as the sun shines and glints on the polished surface.  You cannot even
imagine how much time it must have taken to build such an amazing building. 
Before coming to the Stone City you had heard many stories of the Citadel's
beauty, but still you did not expect to find a building as magical and
enchanting as this.  

<MAPEND>

Guard Room [**> PK <**]
  The guard room is small and crowded.  The walls and low ceiling are
covered with a texture of small pebbles of many different colours, stuck
tightly together.  You feel uncomfortable in the hot room and damp air. 
Echoing sounds that seem to come from below catch your attention for a
moment.  Your mind returns to the tall guards standing in the room, and you
decide to leave as soon as possible, it is not safe to be here.

Jailor's room
  The walls, ceiling, floor and table in this room are all made from a dark
grey stone.  There is little colour here.  Brax the jailor sits on the table
at the edge of the room, softly muttering to himself as he pencils down
notes.  There are two cells ajoining this room, one to the north and one to
the south.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Secret Cell
  This room seems more like a lair than a cell.  Small bits of hay lie
strewn about the floor covering bones of unknown origin.  Splattered blood
and tufts of grey hair lie matted in one corner.  As you turn to leave you
notice a pair of small red eyes peering at you from the darkness.

Hall (727)

A dust devil arrives from the west.
The Grand Entrance
  Nowhere have you seen such an obscene display of wealth than in this
corridor.  The shag carpeting under your feet makes it seem as if you are
walking on a cloud.  Platinum candelabras hang delicately from the ceiling
casting light on the ancient tapestries adorning the walls.  The crick in
your neck tells you it's time to stop staring.  To the west the numerous
halls of the palace begin and the gate lies to the east.  

<MAPEND>

The Northwestern Market Square
  This corner of the market contains some of the most civilized folk in New
Thalos.  To the north lies the humble store of the merchant Ahkeem, his
weavings known to be the best in the city.  West of here is the entrance to
the First Royal Bank of New Thalos.

The Bank
  You stand in a large building decorated with black marble and red satin. 
Huge pillars support an arched ceiling far above your head.  You wonder at
the skill the dwarves have for detail as you examine the trim.  Fine silver
separates the polished blocks that make up the floor.

The Northeastern Market Square
  Pandemonium.  Chaos.  Madness.  A few other choice words come to mind as
you gaze into this corner of the market.  The vegetable stand seems quiet
enough so you have to assume the noise comes from the Butchery.  You have to
think for a while before you muster the will to enter this shop.  The market
continues to the south and west.

e
The Butchery
  This shop has the aroma of freshly slaughterd beasts.  You feel right at
home.  You see a fairly simple set up.  The corpses..  Er...  Selections
hang on hooks, still bleeding into catch pans that drain into a single
underground vat.  You wonder where that leads....  Taped to the counter,
almost obscured by blood, there is a barely readable sign.  

<MAPEND>

>>
n
Vera's Veggies
  This is a busy place.  Customers shuffle around, bartering for lower
prices on the wide selection of vegetables.  You can still hear your mother
telling you 'Eat your Veggies'.  That's probably why you're mudding right
now and not hanging out with mom.  But wait...  Vera looks just like your
mother!  There is a large poster, behind the counter, taped to the wall.  

<MAPEND>

Abdul's Armor

begins here and heads north.  Sounds of loud drunken folk and the occasional
screaming cat emenate from the direction.  Luckily you have the choice of
going east or west down the drive as well.

n
Moonlight Avenue
  You stand on Moonlight avenue, thinking the name is a cruel joke on
surface dwellers for you wish you could see the moon, not the continuous
darkness that lives in this city.  Everywhere darkness creeps, even with the
lights that adorn some of the streets, it is still dark. To your east lies the
entrance to a dark building and it seems to just disappear into the night.  The
door seems to be rusted shut.
 
North and south moonlight continues, east is the door.

Moonlight Avenue
  Moonlight Avenue is a boring street.  Nothing exciting happens here, you
wonder if it is the name.  The street is clean and well travelled.  You seem
oddly at ease on this street.  The shadows seem less dangerous here.  The
light of the floating orbs is unsure and insecure, they seem to flicker in and
out.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

refreeze until it is a hard icy path. It is slippery going, as your boots 
lack sufficient grip to keep you upright for long.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.
